bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

bibl.title: Letter from Fitzhugh Lee to [Jefferson Randolph Kean], [1903]

div1.p: Lee congratulates [Kean] on his speech he gave at the unveiling of the Reed Monument. Lee also wants to know the cost of a non-resident membership in the Army and Navy Club. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Fitzhugh Lee to [Jefferson Randolph Kean], [1903]
div1.opener:
GENERAL FITZHUGH LEE, PRESIDENT
D. LOWENBERG,
DIRECTOR GEN'L
G. T. SHEPPERD.
SECRETARY
N. BEAMAN,
TREASURER
JAMESTOWN EXPOSITION COMPANY INCORPORATED MARCH 10 1902
·1607-1907·
EN DAT QVINTVM
VIRGINIA
T. J. WOOL.
O. D. BATCHELOR.
GEN'L COUNSEL
BARTON MYERS,
AUDITOR
circ Oct. 20, 1927
NORFOLK, VA
My dr Dr. Maj:
div1.p:
A man, a
good judge too, told me yesterday
you made a cracking good
speech in Gloucester at the
unveiling of the Reed monument
& his name was Joseph Bryan
Proprietor “Times dispatch” of Richmond
But that is not what I desire
to say just now.

I find on many matters
from getting 3 or 4 million dollars
from the Government - to Naval & Military
display - Government Exhibit &c &c &c
I have to be in Washington
a great deal in Dec:
& I am, so I am going
to ask you to let me know what
a non resident membership costs
in the metropolitan & in the army
& navy club & if you can generally
get rooms - See?

I do not know whether your
wife is living or not. I have not
heard from her for so long.
If she is, [unclear]!
if not may it “rest in peace”!
Mrs Lee Anne & Virginia & I
are living here c so are Dr. & Mrs.
Starke Come down & bring the
remains of your wife - Lee?

One of the little sons of the latter couple had his
teeth knocked out the other day.
